members.member:
Checks `GameObject` by given path has `Text` component and it's variable text is equals to expected text.
Path to `GameObject` in hierarchy Expected text\

member.name: M:PlayQ.UITestTools.Check.CheckAverageFPS(System.Single)
member.summary: Checks average fps since moment user last time called `Interact.ResetFPS()` method or since game started. If average fps less than `targetFPS` test will faled.
member.param: Minimum allowable value of average fps

member.name: M:PlayQ.UITestTools.Check.CheckMinFPS(System.Single)
member.summary: Checks minimum fps since moment user last time called `Interact.ResetFPS()` method or since game started. If minimum fps less than `targetFPS` test will faled.
member.param: Minimum allowable value of minimum fps

member.name: M:PlayQ.UITestTools.Interact.SetText(UnityEngine.GameObject,System.String)
member.summary: Finds `GameObject` by path, checks if `GameObject` has `Text` component, fail if it has not. If not fail, then set text variable of `Text` to given value.

member.name: M:PlayQ.UITestTools.Interact.SetText(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Finds `GameObject` by path, checks if `GameObject` has `Text` component, fail if it has not. If not fail, then set text variable of `Text` to given value.

member.name: M:PlayQ.UITestTools.Interact.AppendText(UnityEngine.GameObject,System.String)
member.summary: Checks if `GameObject` has `InputField` component. Fails if not. Then appends given text to text variable of `InputField`

member.name: M:PlayQ.UITestTools.Interact.AppendText(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Appends text to `GameObject` by path with `InputField` component.

member.summary: Construct a TimeoutAttribute given a time in milliseconds

summary.para: A float comparer used by Assertions.Assert performing approximate comparison.
Default instance of a comparer class with deafult error epsilon and absolute error check.
Default epsilon used by the comparer.

member.name: M:PlayQ.UITestTools.Assert.FloatComparer.#ctor

summary.para: Creates an instance of the comparer.

member.param: Should a relative check be used when comparing values? By default, an absolute check will be used.
Allowed comparison error. By default, the FloatComparer.kEpsilon is used.

member.name: M:PlayQ.UITestTools.Assert.FloatComparer.#ctor(System.Boolean)

summary.para: Creates an instance of the comparer.

member.param: Should a relative check be used when comparing values? By default, an absolute check will be used.
Allowed comparison error. By default, the FloatComparer.kEpsilon is used.

member.name: M:PlayQ.UITestTools.Assert.FloatComparer.#ctor(System.Single)

summary.para: Creates an instance of the comparer.

member.param: Should a relative check be used when comparing values? By default, an absolute check will be used.
Allowed comparison error. By default, the FloatComparer.kEpsilon is used.

member.name: M:PlayQ.UITestTools.Assert.FloatComparer.#ctor(System.Single,System.Boolean)

summary.para: Creates an instance of the comparer.

member.param: Should a relative check be used when comparing values? By default, an absolute check will be used.
Allowed comparison error. By default, the FloatComparer.kEpsilon is used.

summary.para: Performs equality check with absolute error check.
Performs equality check with relative error check.
An exception that is thrown on a failure. Assertions.Assert._raiseExceptions needs to be set to true.
Should an exception be thrown on a failure.
Asserts that the condition is true.
Asserts that the condition is true.
Asserts that the condition is false.
Asserts that the condition is false.

Asserts that the values are approximately equal. An absolute error check is used for approximate equality check (|a-b| < tolerance). Default tolerance is 0.00001f.
Note: Every time you call the method with tolerance specified, a new instance of Assertions.Comparers.FloatComparer is created. For performance reasons you might want to instance your own comparer and pass it to the AreEqual method. If the tolerance is not specifies, a default comparer is used and the issue does not occur.

Asserts that the values are approximately equal. An absolute error check is used for approximate equality check (|a-b| < tolerance). Default tolerance is 0.00001f.
Note: Every time you call the method with tolerance specified, a new instance of Assertions.Comparers.FloatComparer is created. For performance reasons you might want to instance your own comparer and pass it to the AreEqual method. If the tolerance is not specifies, a default comparer is used and the issue does not occur.

Asserts that the values are approximately equal. An absolute error check is used for approximate equality check (|a-b| < tolerance). Default tolerance is 0.00001f.
Note: Every time you call the method with tolerance specified, a new instance of Assertions.Comparers.FloatComparer is created. For performance reasons you might want to instance your own comparer and pass it to the AreEqual method. If the tolerance is not specifies, a default comparer is used and the issue does not occur.

Asserts that the values are approximately equal. An absolute error check is used for approximate equality check (|a-b| < tolerance). Default tolerance is 0.00001f.
Note: Every time you call the method with tolerance specified, a new instance of Assertions.Comparers.FloatComparer is created. For performance reasons you might want to instance your own comparer and pass it to the AreEqual method. If the tolerance is not specifies, a default comparer is used and the issue does not occur.

Asserts that the values are approximately equal. An absolute error check is used for approximate equality check (|a-b| < tolerance). Default tolerance is 0.00001f.
Note: Every time you call the method with tolerance specified, a new instance of Assertions.Comparers.FloatComparer is created. For performance reasons you might want to instance your own comparer and pass it to the AreEqual method. If the tolerance is not specifies, a default comparer is used and the issue does not occur.
Asserts that the values are approximately not equal. An absolute error check is used for approximate equality check (|a-b| < tolerance). Default tolerance is 0.00001f.
Asserts that the values are approximately not equal. An absolute error check is used for approximate equality check (|a-b| < tolerance). Default tolerance is 0.00001f.
Asserts that the values are approximately not equal. An absolute error check is used for approximate equality check (|a-b| < tolerance). Default tolerance is 0.00001f.
Asserts that the values are approximately not equal. An absolute error check is used for approximate equality check (|a-b| < tolerance). Default tolerance is 0.00001f.
